title: NF+RF+ENH: More comprehensive and configurable meta data support
body:
Broadband improvements:

- [x] A custom context enables us to flexibly expand or adjust it, without having (much) impact on meta data that is already circulating around. And it is also more compact in the datasets ...
- [x] Going to versioned meta data item IDs allows us to distinguish between instances of the same dataset
- [x] config variable `datalad.metadata.parsers.enable` to replace `metadata.nativetypes`
- [x] config variable `datalad.metadata.parsers.disable` for "negative selection"  of parser, i.e. "all but these two"
- [x] annex information now from a separate parser that can be enabled/disabled
- [x] robustify `search` to keep working on mixture of old and new meta data
- [x] each meta data item now comes with a `describedby` property that identifies the responsible parser (with version) to enable flexible and reliable filtering later on
- [x] simple draft of a parser for file-based meta data that can report file name, size, mimetype and encoding
- [x] `search` can now search for datasets _and_ files (datasets by default)
- [x] switch to version 0.2 as meta data standard to reflect the changes
- [x] enhance BIDS meta data parser to produce file-based meta data as well
- [x] enhance `aggregate_metadata` to honor disabled parser in superdatasets -- this way users can configure selective meta data _removal_ in superdatasets, independent of the presence of the entire subtree, or without having to modify any subdataset.
- [x] any non-essential (e.g. file-based) meta data is separated into by-parser files that are (optionally, and by default) annexed.
- [ ] make optional annexed meta data files compressed by default -- no point in diffs anyway, so can be optimized for download
- [ ] RF `search` to make room for alternative search algorithms
- [ ] Implement support for SPARQL queries in `search`
- [ ] add bacon
